Description: Rim and wall sherd of Attic red-figured pottery bell-krater. Laurel on rim, between reserved bands; traces remaining of scene below, unexplained - helmet crest or wings of small Eros?
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For the suggestions of the scene see Boardman's review of Venit.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 100 no. 342 pl. 73)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1006)
